result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Matke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Uncharged possession of a controlled substance stemming from this incident dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K. Matke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:49 p.m. Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Uncharged referral for possession of a controlled substance stemming from this incident dismissed and read in.  No statement by DE. Court orders: 2 days WCJ - 2 days CFTS - Time served sentence, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi regarding status of defendant.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on March 3, 2015 at 10:15 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM:  Defendant Brian K. Matke in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  SPD confirms eligibility.  ADA argues as to bond - Current PO Hold.  Argues for low cash bond or signature with conditions.  SPD has no position on bond.  Court orders $500 Signature Bond w/conditions as requested.   NGP received and entered.  Supervision is through Portage Co.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 10:15 am.
